alert.note: Alert for Dickens; Kent; King; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 3:31AM CDT until July 16 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lubbock Texas has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Kent County in northwestern Texas... Southeastern Dickens County in northwestern Texas... Southern King County in northwestern Texas... Stonewall County in northwestern Texas... * Until 500 AM CDT. * At 331 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Guthrie to Jayton to 5 miles northeast of Fluvanna, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Aspermont, Jayton, Lake Alan Henry, Girard, Peacock, Old Glory, Swenson, Clairemont and Us-380 Near The Haskell- Stonewall County Line. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
